og_meta.title: Home - Oakland Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Oakland Orthodontics provides braces, Invisalign®, iTero scanning, and complimentary consultations for children, teens, and adults in metro Detroit.

image.alt: Team of orthodontic professionals smiling in the Lakeshore Orthodontics office lobby

paragraphs.text: Dr. Archana Dhawan and our entire team have a mission: to serve you and your family through custom care that is of the highest quality. Before creating a treatment plan, Dr. Dhawan assesses both the clinical and personal needs of each patient to deliver a beautiful, one-of-a-kind smile.

We focus on patient-centered care built on respect, two-way communication, specialized training, and comfort. Our practice offers personalized treatment plans including traditional braces and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> alongside advanced diagnostics like iTero® Element scanning and CBCT imaging to make treatment predictable and convenient.

Dr. Archana Dhawan is an American Board Certified Orthodontist with more than two decades of experience creating confident smiles for patients of all ages. Her approach emphasizes clear communication and individualized treatment planning so every patient understands their options and feels comfortable at every visit.
Dr. Dhawan and her team bring together experienced clinical care, modern technology, and a warm office environment to make orthodontic treatment efficient and stress free.

Dr. Dhawan offers both traditional metal and aesthetic clear braces as well as Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners. Our office uses iTero® Element digital scanning and cone-beam imaging (CBCT) when appropriate to improve diagnostic accuracy and streamline treatment planning.

Dr. Dhawan creates an environment where patients feel at ease and are encouraged to ask questions. Treatment is individualized so we can balance clinical needs with patients’ lifestyle, timing, and esthetic goals.

items.name: Clinical Team
items.bio: Our clinical staff supports every step of your orthodontic journey — from scans and impressions to adjustments and patient education. They work closely with Dr. Dhawan to ensure safe, effective, and comfortable care.

items.name: Front Desk & Patient Care
items.bio: Friendly office staff help with appointment scheduling, insurance questions, and financial coordination so your treatment stays on track with minimal stress.

image.alt: Front desk staff assisting a patient

items.name: Office Leadership
items.bio: Our leadership team focuses on patient experience, clinical quality, and the operational details that keep the office running smoothly and hygienically.

slides.alt: Clinic interior - reception and seating area
Office video thumbnail showing treatment area

paragraphs.text: Oakland Orthodontics participates in local health and awareness efforts, including events that promote oral hygiene and reduce anxiety for young patients. We take part in awareness months and community education to make dental health approachable for families.

We support community outreach through free educational demonstrations, meet-and-greet events, and collaboration with local health initiatives to help patients of all ages feel informed and confident about their oral care.

Get Started.title: Orthodontic Treatment That Puts A Smile On Your Face

image.alt: Smiling family welcomed at Lakeshore Orthodontics front desk

Get Started.title: What to expect on your first visit

paragraphs.text: On your first visit we will answer your initial questions, explain treatment options, and take X-rays and impressions if needed. We’ll review your exam findings and give a time estimate so you understand the next steps.

We’ll also discuss financing and insurance, and can schedule follow-up or bonding appointments if you choose to move forward. Bring any prior dental records and your insurance information to speed check-in. If you have questions before your visit, call (248) 817-2623.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: Our team will review treatment cost, expected timelines, and any insurance coverage during your complimentary consultation. Staff members are happy to answer questions about financing or billing so you can choose the option that fits your family.
For booking or billing questions call (248) 817-2623 or request a complimentary consultation online.

To help your first visit run smoothly, start with our online appointment request or contact the office to confirm which intake forms you should complete beforehand. Completing forms ahead of time saves time at check-in and helps us provide safe, personalized care.
Request an appointment or review next steps at our booking page. If you prefer, call (248) 817-2623 and our staff will email any required forms or guide you through the process.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online

Treatments.title: Orthodontic Treatment That Puts A Smile On Your Face

image.alt: Smiling patients in a modern orthodontic clinic

paragraphs.text: Phase-One, or early orthodontic treatment, typically begins after the first orthodontic exam around age eight. The goal is to guide jaw growth, create space for permanent teeth, and address crossbites or underbites early so later treatment is simpler and shorter.

An exam around age seven lets us spot overcrowding, gaps, and bite problems early. Treating growth and bite issues when a child is growing often reduces the need for extractions or more invasive procedures later.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic evaluation

paragraphs.text: We may use expanders, space maintainers, jaw repositioning appliances, or lip/cheek bumpers to correct growth-related issues. These tools help guide development with gentler, shorter treatment when possible.

Dr. Archana Dhawan has spent over two decades crafting smiles for patients of all ages. We offer traditional and aesthetic braces plus Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners, supported by advanced diagnostics like digital scanning and cone-beam imaging.
Adults with crowns, fillings, or implants can often be treated; we coordinate with your dental team to ensure safe, effective care.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking a selfie

paragraphs.text: Both metal and ceramic braces move teeth reliably. Treatment may include adjustments, elastics, and occasional auxiliary appliances. Good hygiene and avoiding hard or sticky foods help keep treatment on track.
Avoid chewy, hard, or crunchy foods that can damage brackets and wires. Musicians and athletes can get specific advice or protective options to stay comfortable while in treatment.
Ceramic braces blend with tooth color for a less noticeable look while still delivering effective tooth movement for many cases.

image.alt: Patient smiling with aesthetic orthodontic appliance

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> aligners are a removable, discreet option for many cases. We use digital scans to design precise aligners and review hygiene and wear-time expectations so your treatment stays on schedule.
A Free Online Smile Evaluation is available to preview potential results before you visit.

image.alt: Close-up of clear aligner on teeth

paragraphs.text: Orthognathic surgery corrects jaw and bite discrepancies that affect function and comfort. When surgery is recommended, we coordinate closely with surgeons and plan orthodontic timing to optimize both function and appearance.
Primary goals include improving chewing, bite alignment, and facial balance; careful planning ensures the best possible functional outcome.

image.alt: Orthodontic consultation for jaw surgery planning

paragraphs.text: After active treatment, retainers keep your teeth in their new positions. Follow the wear schedule your orthodontist prescribes and store retainers in their case when not in use to avoid loss or damage.
We offer both removable and fixed retainer options and provide guidance to maintain long-term stability of your smile.
We use modern digital tools to improve comfort, precision, and predictability—everything from digital scanners to 3D planning software for surgical and aligner cases.
Fast, radiation-free scans capture precise 3D images for better treatment planning and comfortable impressions.
CBCT gives detailed 3D views that improve diagnosis and surgical planning when needed.

image.alt: Cone-beam imaging and digital X-ray equipment

paragraphs.text: Advanced software simulates tooth movement and surgical outcomes so you can see an informed preview of your treatment.

image.alt: Modern orthodontic office interior with advanced equipment

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our Emeryville office

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about braces, Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, appointment scheduling, and payment plans so you can feel confident during every step of your orthodontic care.

Braces do not hurt when they’re initially put on. You may have soreness afterward and when your teeth move, but most patients report the initial placement is easier than they expected. We answer additional questions at the initial exam and bonding appointment so you’ll always know what to expect.

We provide a time estimate at the initial exam tailored to each patient’s needs. Treatment length varies by case — some patients finish in about a year, others may need two to three years depending on complexity.

accordion.header: Can I chew gum and wear braces?

paragraphs.text: Sugarless gum is less sticky and less likely to cause problems, and some patients find chewing sugarless gum relieves soreness after adjustments. Gum increases saliva, which can help protect enamel, but sticky gum may still damage brackets. Check with us during your visit for the best advice for your specific appliance.

accordion.header: Do I still visit my general dentist while in orthodontic treatment?

paragraphs.text: Yes. Continue to visit your general dentist every six months or as recommended in addition to your orthodontic adjustments. Routine dental checkups and cleanings are important for preventing cavities and gum disease while wearing braces or aligners.

accordion.header: What foods should I avoid while in treatment?

paragraphs.text: Avoid chewy or sticky foods like taffy and gum, hard items such as nuts and ice, and very crunchy foods like uncut apples or raw carrots. You can often modify foods — cut apples or steam vegetables — so you can still enjoy many favorites safely.

accordion.header: How can I avoid delays during treatment?

paragraphs.text: Keep adjustment appointments, report broken wires or brackets promptly, wear elastics as prescribed, and maintain good oral hygiene. Missing appointments or not following directions can add weeks or months to your treatment timeline.

Two-phase treatment may be recommended when early intervention helps jaw and bite development. Phase One addresses jaw or growth issues and creates space for permanent teeth, while Phase Two uses braces to finalize alignment. Signs that suggest early evaluation include early tooth loss, bite problems, prolonged thumb-sucking, or crowded teeth by age seven or eight.
